content.raw:
In the previous pull request you mention this addresses [this](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/1859/issue_1702/diff#comment-9785285) comment, but I can still reproduce that issue. Gazebo crashes with: 

~~~
Qt has caught an exception thrown from an event handler. Throwing
exceptions from an event handler is not supported in Qt. You must
reimplement QApplication::notify() and catch all exceptions there.

terminate called after throwing an instance of 'Ogre::ItemIdentityException'
  what():  OGRE EXCEPTION(4:ItemIdentityException): An object of type 'Entity' with name 'unit_box_0_clone::link_COM_VISUAL____SPHERE__' already exists. in SceneManager::createMovableObject at /build/buildd/ogre-1.9-1.9.0+dfsg1/OgreMain/src/OgreSceneManager.cpp (line 6832)
~~~

Does this pull request need all previous parts (1, 2, 3) before it can be tested?
content.html:
In the previous pull request you mention this addresses this comment, but I can still reproduce that issue. Gazebo crashes with: 

Qt has caught an exception thrown from an event handler. Throwing
exceptions from an event handler is not supported in Qt. You must
reimplement QApplication::notify() and catch all exceptions there.

terminate called after throwing an instance of 'Ogre::ItemIdentityException'
  what():  OGRE EXCEPTION(4:ItemIdentityException): An object of type 'Entity' with name 'unit_box_0_clone::link_COM_VISUAL____SPHERE__' already exists. in SceneManager::createMovableObject at /build/buildd/ogre-1.9-1.9.0+dfsg1/OgreMain/src/OgreSceneManager.cpp (line 6832)

Does this pull request need all previous parts (1, 2, 3) before it can be tested?
